</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Total operating revenues for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$747.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1,263.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Total operating revenues are predominantly contract revenues with additional amounts of reimbursable and related party revenue. The decrease in total operating revenues was primarily due to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Navigator
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;finishing its contract in January 2015, which has contributed to approximately $244.3 million of the decrease as compared to 2014. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Venture
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;also ended its contract in August 2015, which has contributed to approximately $53.9 million of the decrease as compared to 2014. Lower operating dayrates on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Phoenix
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Epsilon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Elara
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;contributed to a decrease of approximately $46.5 million, $20.1 million and $15.7 million respectively as compared to 2014. In addition, lower reimbursable revenue on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Alpha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;contributed to a fall of approximately $97.3 million as compared to 2014, due to completion of winterization projects for Kara Sea operations. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Elara
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;also had lower reimbursable revenue, contributing to a fall of approximately $20.3 million as compared to 2014. In 2014, we earned related party revenues of $44.0 million relating to our management of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on behalf of Seadrill. No such revenue was earned in 2015. The fall in revenue was partly offset by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which commenced operations in May 2014, and contributed to an increase of approximately $44.6 million in revenues for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as compared to 2014. The remaining movements relate to variations in the operating performance of the drilling units.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loss on disposals
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	As a result of the agreement with Jurong, we have concluded that the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Rigel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	drilling unit should be classified as &#8220;Held for Sale&#8221; as at December&#160;31, 2015, and accordingly we have recognized an impairment loss of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$82 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Refer to Note 12 - "Asset held for sale" to our Consolidated Financial Statements included herein for more information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$(568.2) million
</FONT>

	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$(1,380.1) million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Total operating expenses consist of vessel and rig operating expenses, depreciation and amortization, impairment charges, general and administrative expenses and reimbursable expenses. Vessel and rig operating expenses decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$187.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, primarily due to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Navigator
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Venture
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;completing their contracts, as discussed in the revenues section above. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Phoenix
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was also warm stacked for the fourth quarter of 2015, resulting in lower operating costs. In addition our cost-cutting initiatives have resulted in lower personnel and repairs and maintenance costs across all units. The weakening of the Norwegian kroner against the U.S. dollar has also caused reductions in operating expenses. The decrease in vessel and rig
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	38

</A>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	operating expenses is partly offset by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which commenced operations in May 2014. Reimbursable expenses decreased by a total of $134.6 million. This was mainly driven by the decrease in reimbursables on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;West Alpha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which contributed to a fall of approximately $90.6 million as compared to 2014. Depreciation expenses increased by a total of $9.8 million, which was driven by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;being available for operations commencing May 2014. The decrease in operating expenses was also primarily related to a loss on impairment relating to goodwill of $480.6 million in 2014, for which there was none of in 2015. General and administration expenses decreased by $18.8 million in 2015 as compared to 2014 due to the transaction fees and costs relating to our relocation to Oslo in 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The loss on derivative financial instruments relates to fair value adjustments and net settlements on our interest rate swaps, cross currency swaps and forward exchange contracts. During the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, the recognized loss from derivative financial instruments was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$57.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to a loss of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$86.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. These figures include realized net settlements on the derivative financial instruments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$37.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$32.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;respectively. The unrealized losses were due to the falls in the fair market value of these derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Foreign exchange gain was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$28.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to a gain of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$41.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. This was primarily due to the Norwegian kroner weakening against the U.S. dollar during 2015 and 2014, with gains recognized in respect of our NOK-denominated debt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Income tax expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$44.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$29.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Our effective tax rate was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	-127.8%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	-10.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The increase in the negative effective tax rate is due to the loss on derivatives, which is recognized in a non-taxable jurisdiction. This means that we continue to pay tax on local operations but reported an overall a loss before tax inclusive of discrete items.&#160; The negative rate reflects no tax relief on the impairments or the derivative loss. This is due to these items largely falling within the zero tax rate on Bermuda companies. In addition, the increase in the tax expense in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in comparison to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;is mainly due to deferred tax liability recorded on unremitted earnings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We may be taxable in more than one jurisdiction based on our drilling rig operations. A loss in one jurisdiction may not be offset against taxable income in another jurisdiction. Thus, we may pay tax within some jurisdictions even though it might have an overall loss at the consolidated level.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Significant amounts of our income and costs are reported in non-taxable jurisdictions such as Bermuda. The drilling rig operations are normally carried out in taxable jurisdictions. In the tax jurisdictions where we operate, the corporate income tax rates range from 20% to 27% for earned income. Further, losses in one tax jurisdiction may not be offset against taxable income in other jurisdictions. Accordingly, the effective tax rate may differ significantly from period to period depending on the level of activity in and mix of each of the tax jurisdictions in which our operations are conducted.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	39
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Total operating revenues for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$1,263.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1,324.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Total operating revenues are predominantly contract revenues with additional amounts of reimbursable and related party revenue. The decrease in total operating revenues was primarily due to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;moving from a bareboat agreement to a management agreement in November 2013 resulting in revenue being billed from Seadrill. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;commenced operations in January 2013 and contributed $128.3 million of contract revenues in 2013 compared to nil in 2014. Similarly, reimbursable revenues decreased by $34.3 million due reimbursable work to winterize the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, in 2013 of $112.0 million offset by an increase of $74.5 million of reimbursable revenue from preparing the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Alpha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	for operations in the Kara Sea. Related party revenues were $44.9 million in 2014 compared to $12.1 million in 2013 due to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	management agreement in November 2013. In addition the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;commenced operations in May 2014, contributing $79.8 million of revenues in 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Total operating expenses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	The following table sets forth our total operating expenses for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Total operating expenses for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	(1,380.1) million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	(963.7) million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Total operating expenses consist of vessel and rig operating expenses, depreciation and amortization, general and administrative expenses and reimbursable expenses. The increase in operating expenses was primarily related to a loss on impairment relating to goodwill of $480.6 million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;moving from a bareboat agreement to a management agreement led to decreased operating expenses of $78.0 million in 2014, mostly due to no bareboat fee of $58.5 million. This was offset by operating expenses for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;commencing operations of $37.7 million. Reimbursable expenses decreased by $33.7 million, mainly related to the winterization work on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Hercules
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;which was recharged to Statoil in 2013. There was also an increase in general and administrative expenses of $7.0 million in professional fees which includes transactions fees for the Rosneft transactions and $3.0 million for relocating offices to Oslo.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest expense
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Interest expense for the year ended December 31, 2014 was $103.8 million, compared to $84.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. The increase was primarily due to an increase in interest bearing debt to $2,774.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2014 compared to $2,447.9 million in 2013. The main refinancing activity took place at the start of the year being the $600 million 6.25% Senior Unsecured Notes due 2019 in January 2014 and $475 million Credit Facility for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	in February 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	40
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	(6.5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Total other financial items
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	(70.7
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	15.9
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">

</FONT>

</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The loss on derivative financial instruments relates to fair value adjustments to our interest rate swaps, cross currency swaps and forward exchange contracts. During the year ended December 31, 2014, the recognized loss from derivative financial instruments was $86.2 million, compared to a loss of $16.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. These losses were primarily due to adjustments for the fair market value of these derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Foreign exchange gain was $41.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to a gain of $10.9 million in the year ended December 31, 2013. This was primarily due to the Norwegian kroner weakening against the U.S. dollar during 2014 and 2013 in respect of our NOK-denominated debt. The other financial items of $26.0 million are mostly related to $22.5 million termination fee for the $500 million 7.75% bond redeemed in February 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Income tax expense was $29.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, compared to $28.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2013. Our effective tax rate was approximately (10.2%) for the year ended December 31, 2014, as compared to 10.9% for the year ended December 31, 2013. The negative effective tax rate results from the non-taxable loss on impairment of $480.6 million which was recognized during the year ended December 31, 2014. On April 1, 2014, there was a legislation change to the bareboat charter measure in the United Kingdom where a cap on the bareboat charter deduction was introduced. The impact on the tax expense for the year ended December 31, 2014 was an increase of $5.3 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Significant amounts of our income and costs are reported in non-taxable jurisdictions such as Bermuda. The drilling rig operations are normally carried out in taxable jurisdictions. In the tax jurisdictions where we operate, the corporate income tax rates range from 20% to 27% for earned income. Further, losses in one tax jurisdiction may not be offset against taxable income in other jurisdictions. Accordingly, the effective tax rate may differ significantly from period to period depending on the level of activity in and mix of each of the tax jurisdictions in which our operations are conducted.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="NADL20F2015_HTM_S8E5C144C6DA847AF9B22522D80D3C0B8">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We operate in a capital-intensive industry. Historically, our investment in newbuild drilling units, secondhand drilling units and our acquisition of other companies has been financed through cash generated from operations, and a combination of equity issuances, bond and convertible bond offerings, and borrowings from commercial banks and export credit agencies. Our liquidity requirements relate to servicing and repaying our debt, funding investment in drilling units, funding working capital requirements, funding potential dividend payments and maintaining adequate cash reserves to mitigate the effects of fluctuations in operating cash flows. Most of our contract and other revenues are received monthly in arrears, and most of our operating costs are paid on a monthly basis.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Our funding and treasury activities are conducted within corporate policies to maximize returns while maintaining appropriate liquidity for our operating requirements. Cash and cash equivalents are held mainly in U.S. dollars, with lesser amounts held in Norwegian Kroner and Brazilian Real.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	This section discusses the most important factors affecting the liquidity and capital resources of the company, including:
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Summary of our borrowing activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	, we had total outstanding borrowings under our credit facilities of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$2,449.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$2,730.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. This includes interest bearing debt under loan agreements with related parties of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$321.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	41
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We have issued a variety of secured and unsecured borrowings. Total secured debt totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1,554.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Generally the secured debt amortizes over a period of five to ten years, with a balloon payment at maturity. The debt is secured by, among other things, liens on our drilling units. In addition, all of our loan agreements contain cross-default provisions, meaning that if we are in default under one of our loan agreements, amounts outstanding under our other loan agreements may also be in default, accelerated and become due and payable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In addition, we had unsecured bonds totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$770.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Our unsecured debt consists of bonds denominated primarily in U.S. dollars, but also in Norwegian kroner, at both fixed and floating rates of interest. For the floating bonds in Norwegian kroner, we have entered into cross-currency interest rate swaps to fix the interest and exchange rates to the U.S. dollar.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	During the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;we made external debt repayments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$305.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$430.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;this consisted of normal debt amortizations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;we issued a bond (the Senior Unsecured Notes) with an aggregate principal of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$600 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,coupon rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and maturity in 2019. We used the gross proceeds of the senior unsecured notes issuance for the prepayment of indebtedness and transaction expenses and general corporate purposes. Seadrill has purchased approximately 31.1% of the aggregate principal amount of the notes. In addition, in 2014, SFL Linus Ltd, which we consolidate as a variable interest entity, drew down on its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$475 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;secured term loan and revolving credit facility to fund the acquisition of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	As at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;we had a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$50 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of undrawn borrowing capacity under our existing credit facilities. At the current time, however, we are restricted from drawing down on any of this capacity due to restrictions in our debt agreements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The outstanding debt as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;is repayable as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Liquidity outlook
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Our short-term liquidity requirements relate to servicing our debt amortizations, interest payments, and funding working capital requirements. Sources of liquidity include existing cash balances, and contract and other revenues. We have historically relied on our cash generated from operations to meet our working capital needs. In the past we have also relied on revolving credit facilities provided by Seadrill.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We anticipate that we will be required to obtain additional liquidity provided by Seadrill in order to fully meet our short term liquidity requirements over the next twelve months. Our previous $85m revolving credit facility with Seadrill expired in January 2015.&#160; At the current point in time no revolving credit facility is in place.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Our long-term liquidity requirements include the repayment of long-term debt balances. On April 28, 2016 we entered into an amendment to defer the maturity our US$2 billion senior secured credit facility, which has a balloon payment of $950 million on maturity, from April 15, 2017 until June 30, 2017. We expect the need to refinance this facility with additional issuances of debt and/or new equity in order to meet our obligations as they become due.&#160;The Company's secured credit facilities and NOK 1,500 million bond are guaranteed by Seadrill, and cross default clauses exist between our secured credit facilities and bonds and Seadrill's other credit facilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We are currently working with our banks and advisers to evaluate financing alternatives in light of industry and capital market conditions. We aim to further communicate our financing plans later this year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Covenants contained within our borrowings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Our credit facilities generally contain financial covenants. In February 2015, we received approval to amend the agreements for our NOK
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1,500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;senior unsecured bond,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2,000 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;Senior Secured Credit Facility, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$475 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;secured term loan. Under the terms of each agreement, Seadrill provides guarantees for the bonds and credit facility in exchange for amendments to the covenant package, principally replacing the previous financial covenants with Seadrill's financial covenants, which are measured at the Seadrill consolidated level.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	42
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Please see "
</FONT>

	Note 14
</FONT>

	&#8211;Long term debt" to our Consolidated Financial Statements included herein, for further information on the covenants contained within our credit facilities and bonds.

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Please see "Item 3. Key Information&#8212;D. Risk Factors" for further information on the risks facing our Company and implications of a breach in financial covenants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In February 2015, we received approval to amend the agreements for our NOK
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1,500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;senior unsecured bond,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2,000 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;Senior Secured Credit Facility, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$475 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;secured term loan. Under the terms of each agreement, Seadrill provides guarantees for the bonds and credit facility in exchange for amendments to the covenant package, principally replacing the current financial covenants with Seadrill's financial covenants, which are measured at the Seadrill consolidated level.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In May 2015, Seadrill executed an amendment to the covenants contained in all of its secured credit facilities. Under the amended terms, the permitted leverage ratio has been amended to the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	6.0:1, from and including the financial quarter starting on July 1, 2015 and including the financial quarter ending on September 30, 2016;
</FONT>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.5:1, from and including the financial quarter starting on January 1, 2017 until the final maturity date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In connection with the amendment, effective from July 1, 2015, an additional margin may be payable on the senior secured credit facilities as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.125 percent per annum if the leverage ratio is 4.50:1 up to and including 4.99:1;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.25 percent per annum if the leverage ratio is 5.00:1 up to and including 5.49:1; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.75 percent per annum if the leverage ratio is 5.50:1 up to and including 6.00:1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In addition, as part of the amendments to the covenants contained in the Company&#8217;s senior secured credit facilities in May 2015, the Company is restricted from making dividend distributions, and repurchasing its own shares during the amendment period until January 1, 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On April 28, 2016, Seadrill and the Company executed amendment and waiver agreements in respect of all of their senior secured credit facilities. The maturity of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;senior secured credit facility has been extended to June 30, 2017. In addition, the key terms and conditions of these agreements are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equity ratio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: Seadrill is required to maintain a total equity to total assets ratio of at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	30.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Prior to the amendment, both total equity and total assets are adjusted for the difference between book and market values of drilling units, as determined by independent broker valuations. The amendment removes the need for the market value adjustment from the calculation of the equity ratio until June 30, 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leverage ratio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: the Seadrill is required to maintain a ratio of net debt to EBITDA. Prior to the amendment the leverage ratio had to be no greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1, falling to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1 from October 1, 2016, and falling again to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1 from January 1, 2017. The amendment retains the ratio at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1 until December 31, 2016, and then increases to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1 between January 1, 2017 and June 30, 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Minimum-value-clauses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: Seadrill's and the Company's secured bank credit facilities contain loan-to-value clauses, or minimum-value-clauses (&#8220;MVC&#8221;), which could require the Seadrill and the Company to post additional collateral or prepay a portion of the outstanding borrowings should the value of the drilling units securing borrowings under each of such agreements decrease below required levels. This covenant has been suspended until June 30, 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Minimum Liquidity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: The aggregated minimum liquidity requirement for the Seadrill Group to maintain cash and cash equivalents of at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$150 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;has been increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$250 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Additional undertakings:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Further process
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: Seadrill and the Company has agreed to consultation, information provision and certain processes in respect of further discussions with its lenders under its senior secured credit facilities. This includes agreements in respect of progress milestones towards the agreement of, and implementation plan in respect of, a comprehensive financing package.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	granting security; and
</FONT>
</DIV>

</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#9702;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	payments in respect of newbuild drilling units,
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	in each case, subject to limited exceptions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	&#9702;
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Undrawn availability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	: Seadrill and the Company has agreed to refrain from borrowing any undrawn commitments under its senior secured credit facilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:4PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD>
</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

	&#9702;

	Fees
</FONT>

	: The Company has agreed to pay certain fees to its lenders in consideration of these extensions and amendments.
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	These extensions and amendments are designed to provide Seadrill and the Company and the banking group with a period of stability and certainty while a more comprehensive financing package is agreed. Seadrill and the Company intends to further communicate these financing plans this year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Seadrill and the Company expect to remain in compliance with the amended covenants in 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Our Newbuilding Program
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We have entered into a construction contract for one sixth-generation harsh environment semi-submersible, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Rigel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, with corresponding contractual commitments, including project management, operation preparations, and variation orders, totaling $717.5 million of which we have paid $204.3 million to date. The West Rigel was scheduled to be delivered to us in the fourth quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On December 2, 2015, we signed an amendment with Jurong for the deferral of the delivery of the semi-submersible drilling unit, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Rigel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;(the "Unit"). The deferral period lasts until June 2016, following completion of which, we and Jurong have agreed to form a joint asset holding company for joint ownership of the Unit, to be owned
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	23%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;by us and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	77%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;by Jurong, in the event no employment is secured for the Unit and no alternative transaction is completed. Until the end of the deferral period, the Company will continue to market the unit for an acceptable drilling contract, and the Unit will remain at the Jurong Shipyard in Singapore. We and Jurong may also consider other commercial opportunities for the Unit during this period. However, based on current market conditions, management deems the most probable outcome to be that the Unit will be contributed to the joint asset holding company. As a result of the above, we have concluded that the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Rigel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;should be classified as an asset held for sale as at December 31, 2015. Please see &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Note 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8211;Asset held for sale&#8221; of the Consolidated Financial Statements contained herein for further information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Sources and Uses of Cash
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	At December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we had cash and cash equivalents totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The net cash generated from operations increased in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;primarily due to working capital improvements in the year, including improved collections of trade receivables and related party balances. Net changes in operating assets and liabilities were an inflow of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$114.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;compared to an outflow of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$58.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. We also spent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$30.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on long-term maintenance in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$155.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, due to the implementation of our cost savings program. The increase in net cash generated from operations was partly offset by a reduction in underlying operating income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Net cash used in Investing activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	44
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The net cash used in investing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$39.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in

	2015

	$447.5 million
</FONT>

	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. In 2014 we paid the final yard installment for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	West Linus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	which was completed in the first half of 2014. No newbuildings were completed in 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>

	Net cash used in Financing activities

	he net cash used in financing activities was

	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. During the year ended December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;we made external debt repayments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$305.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, compared to

	$430.5 million

	&#32;in
